data.headline: Major indices up around 0.3% midday after early Nasdaq drop of over 1% amid ongoing AI disruption and spending concerns.
bullets: Megacap tech and chip stocks like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Amazon remain under pressure after recent multi-trillion dollar value losses.
Financials and big banks such as JPMorgan and Bank of America outperform, while small caps and the Russell 2000 slightly lag.
Danaher tumbles on weak earnings results, while Warner Bros. Discovery rises after rejecting Paramountâ€™s offer amid renewed M&A speculation.
ZIM Integrated Shipping soars on a $4.2B buyout bid; Rivian surges following analyst upgrades; select biotech names rally.
No major economic data released beyond a subdued New York/Empire State manufacturing print, leaving traders focused on FOMC minutes this afternoon.
Markets eye upcoming PCE inflation, Q4 GDP, jobless claims, and earnings from Nvidia, Walmart, Palo Alto Networks, DoorDash, Energy Transfer, and Vulcan Materials later this week.
